intro: Atelandra laurina, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It produces small, round fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Atelandra laurina is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitats.
